name: Evcoap
body:
### What is it
Evcoap aims at providing a fully compliant implementation of the [CoAP protocol](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-core-coap), of its discovery companion [Link-Format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6690), and of the pretty useful [Observe](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-core-observe) and [Block](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-core-block) options.

Evcoap is based on [Libevent 2.x](http://libevent.org) by Niels Provos and Nick Mathewson, and shares much of the design philosophy found in the evhttp front-end to libevent.

The final goal is to give libevent users a robust set of tools for creating CoAP based applications, including HTTP-CoAP interworking proxies.

### Authors and Contributors
Founding project members are @yrz, @salvatoreloreto, and @babongo.
